main event: A report detailing the procedures for the follow-up investigation of UFO sightings was prepared by the 4602d AISS after a visit from ATIC representatives.
interesting points: The committee highlighted the need for specific criteria to evaluate UFO reports including duration of sighting, number of witnesses, and reliability of the reports., A differentiation between non-Air Force and Air Force reported sightings was established for follow-up procedures., There is an emphasis on obtaining additional information quickly following a sighting., Follow-up investigations may not be warranted if initial hypotheses cannot be tested with available facilities., The existence of physical evidence, such as photographs or material objects, could warrant further investigation regardless of other criteria.
witness description: No specific witnesses are documented in the report as it focuses on procedures.
